header.title: Prime Quick Login
header.description: Adds a login area to the top of every page.
header.author-notes:
Support is given for both prosilver and subsilver2 templates. If you are using other templates then you will need to modify the template instructions to fit your templates.
Creating, maintaining, and updating MODs requires a lot of time and effort, so if you like this MOD and have the desire to express your thanks through donations, that would be greatly appreciated. My Paypal ID is primehalo@gmail.com, or contact me for my mailing address. The suggested donation amount for this MOD is $3.00 (but any amount will help).

changelog.change: Initial test release
The login confirmation page will now redirect a user to the page from which they logged on.
Fixed a bug that prevented administrators from being able to re-authenticate themselves.
Stopped the form from displaying when the page is going to be automatically refreshed.
Added tab-index numbers to the form elements.

Fixed a bug that caused Firefox to make only the first half of the Submit button clickable, and caused Internet Explorer to place the form on its own line instead of being left-aligned on the same line as the right-aligned links.
Updated for phpBB RC5.
Changed the MOD's name from Prime Login Anywhere to Prime Quick Login.
Added my own template variable to indicate if a page is going to be automatically refreshed.
Added my own text for the auto-login option, so that it could be made much shorter than the default text.
Added a check for IN_PHPBB to the language file, as per RC7.
Repackaged for MODX 1.2.0.
Fixed a typo in the subsilver2 installation instructions which prevented the "In-line Add after" instruction from showing up.
Repackaged to comply with MOD Team Leader wGEric's specifications for proper packaging.
Confirmed compatibility with phpBB3.0.RC7.
Fixed a bug that would cause the page to auto-redirect outside of the board if using the quick login within a subdirectory of the board.
Made fully compatible with another one of my MODs, Prime Login via E-Mail.
Can be used with any language without requiring translations (if no translation is available, it will use the board's default text).
Fixed a minor Internet Explorer bug that would cause links to the right of the quick login form to wrap unnecessarily when the window reached a certain width.
Repackaged to fix the Firefox 3 restricted parent directory issue.
Fixed a minor bug which prevented the "Username or E-Mail" text from showing up when the Prime Login via E-Mail MOD was installed and active.
Moved the HTML code into a separate file for easier manageability.
Added the "Hide me" option.
Added the ability to display or remove the "Remember me" option without having to manually remove it from the HTML code.
Added the ability to display or remove the "Hide me" option without having to manually remove it from the HTML code.
Updated for phpBB 3.0.3.
Updated installation instructions for phpbb 3.0.4.
Fixed a minor issue dealing with integration of the Prime Login via Email modification.
Fixed the option allowing the quick login form to not display when on a real login page.
Fixed redirecting to the page the user was when logging in even when on a page that is outside of the forum directory structure.
